head.title: Two Fatally Shot in L.I. House, Police Say

hedline.hl1: Two Fatally Shot in L.I. House, Police Say

abstract.p: Police say woman and her former husband were fatally shot in house in Elmont, NY; investigators are trying to locate their son (S)

block.p: A woman and her former husband were fatally shot last night in a house in Elmont, on Long Island, and investigators were trying to locate the couple's 20-year-old son, the Nassau County police said.
The couple, described as a man in his 50s and a woman in her 40s, were not identified by the police pending family notification.
A woman and her former husband were fatally shot last night in a house in Elmont, on Long Island, and investigators were trying to locate the couple's 20-year-old son, the Nassau County police said.
The couple, described as a man in his 50s and a woman in her 40s, were not identified by the police pending family notification.

The man and the woman were divorced, and only the woman lived at the home with their son, said Detective Lt. Kevin Smith, a spokesman for the Nassau police. It was unclear why the ex-husband had been at the house, he said.

The police said that they had no suspects last night, but that several neighbors said they saw a dark car leave the house at 1310 Post Avenue about 5:45 p.m., which was about the same time a 911 call came in from a neighbor. Police investigators believe that the two were shot shortly before the call came in. They were declared dead at the scene about 5:50 p.m.
The couple had lived in the neighborhood for at least seven years, according to neighbors.
